reviews.text: Nice view and we have seen some interesting bird life there too. The area is quite dirty though, and there are a lot of dog poo around. There is a little park in one side and a larger abandoned area on the other. Would be a great place to picnic with a bit of care and attention.
Nothing special to see, but good for a walk. Amazing view from in to castle. Short distance from city center. Around are small gardens where you can have sit and have your lunch.

Gates are closed (I tried to enter from the South Gate, blue color, the only entrance Google is pointing out in the map), so I couldn't go up. But the stairs that take you to the gate gives you enough height to take panoramic pictures, can see very well the structure of the Santa Barbara castle from here, and a view of the city and the sea.  

It's is not well taken care of, lots of graffitis and broken glasses (beer bottles) around.  It could be better maintained and have a sign for visitors.

I haven't had enough time for looking for the other gate, there must be one (probably the main entrance?).  
I'd suggest that whoever manages to get there please contribute the details in Google map, thanks everyone :)

Not a lot of the structure is left but interesting to visit, explore and enjoy the wonderful views across Alicante. There is a very nice cafe restaurant bar which has an outside patio area where you can enjoy the views and some refreshments or even a meal. We visit most Sundays as we enjoy the exercise walking up there, then to sit and relax with a little refreshment prior to having their excellent choice of menu of the day.
A nice family hike in the middle of the city.  Worth to visit with kids. Don't forget your skateboard...
